get.summary: Gets a list of challenges for the user
get.description:
The typeData property returns different set of properties depending on the challenge type 
             * SuggestedSpending:
                 "typeData": {
                   "targetPercentage": 10,
                   "categoryIds": [12, 13, 14],
                   "spentAmount": 10000.0,
                   "targetAmount": 9000.0,
                   "numberOfParticipants": 0,
                   "recurringInterval": "Monthly"
                 }
             
             * CustomSpending:
                 "typeData": {
                   "categoryIds": [12, 13, 14],
                   "spentAmount": 10000.0,
                   "targetAmount": 9000.0,
                   "recurringInterval": "Monthly",
                   "metaData": ""
                 }
            
            Expired challenges:
            A challenge is considered expired when the challenge's end date has passed. That applies to recurring
            challenges too. The expired flag does not refer to a period in a recurring challenge being completed.
            The completed periods of recurring challenges are not returned by this endpoint.
            
            Suggested challenges:
            A suggested challenge is a challenge that is not created by the user and one that the user can accept.
            
            Accepted challenges:
            An accepted challenge is a suggested challenge that the user has accepted.
            
            Disabled challenges:
            A disabled challenges is a challenge that the user has decided to ignore/disable.

parameters.name: includeExpired
parameters.description: Include expired challenges in the response. Default: false (expired challenges are not included in the response)

parameters.name: excludeSuggested
parameters.description: Skip suggested/system challenges in the response. Default: false (suggested/system challenges are included in the response)

parameters.name: excludeAccepted
parameters.description: Skip accepted challenges in the response. Default: false (accepted challenges are included in the response)

parameters.name: includeDisabled
parameters.description: Include ignored/disabled challenges in the response. Default: false (ignored/disabled challenges are not included in the response)

401.description: The request requires user authentication. If the request already included Authorization credentials, then the 401 response indicates that authorization has been refused for those credentials.

500.description: The server encountered an unexpected condition which prevented it from fulfilling the request.

The typeData property takes different set of properties depending on the type that should be created

                   "metaData": ""

get.summary: Get a list of transactions

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma separated list of what fields should be returned, if null, returns all fields.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: How many transactions should be skipped

parameters.name: take
parameters.description: How many transactions should be fetched. If null, returns 1000.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
Tells which related resources should be included in the response as 'included' data.
            Supported resources are "Account" and "Merchant", e.g. "Account,Merchant" to get both resources included

parameters.name: includeDisabledAccounts
parameters.description: Whether or not to include transactions from disabled accounts in the result

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Decides the order of the returned transactions, defined by a comma separated list of the properties of the Transaction object.
The sort order for each sort field is ascending unless it is prefixed with a "-" in which case it is descending.
If this string is null or empty then 'OrderBy' is used.
<para>
The supported Transaction fields are:
AccountId, Accuracy, Amount, AmountInCurrency, Balance,BankId, CategoryChangedTime, CategoryId, Date, DueDate, HasUserClearedCategoryUncertainty, Id,
IsFlagged,IsMerchant, IsOwnAccountTransfer, IsRead, IsSplitChild, IsUncleared, InsertTime, Mcc, MerchantId, ParentIdentifier, Text, Timestamp, CounterpartyAccountIdentifier,
Currency, HasUncertainCategorization, OriginalAmount, OriginalDate, OriginalText
</para>

parameters.name: accountIds
parameters.description: A comma separate string of account Ids to filter by

parameters.name: accountIdentifiers
parameters.description: A comma separate string of account identifiers to filter by

parameters.name: counterpartyAccountIdentifiers
parameters.description: A comma separate string of counterparty account identifiers (who person is paying) to filter by

parameters.name: categoryIds
parameters.description: A comma separate string of category Ids to filter by

parameters.name: categoryTypes
parameters.description: A comma separate string of category types to filter by. An enum of the category type are defined in the "GET /user/v1/categories/types" endpoint.

parameters.name: onlyUnread
parameters.description: Whether or not to only get unread transactions

parameters.name: onlyFlagged
parameters.description: Whether or not to only get flagged transactions

parameters.name: onlyUncertain
parameters.description: Whether or not to only get transactions with uncertain categorization

parameters.name: onlyUncategorized
parameters.description: Whether or not to only get uncategorized transactions

parameters.name: uncertainOrFlagged
parameters.description: Whether or not to get uncertain categorization or flagged transactions

parameters.name: hideExcluded
parameters.description: Whether or not to hide transactions in a excluded category

parameters.name: insertedBefore
parameters.description: If set, will only return transactions that have insert time before the supplied value

parameters.name: periodFrom
parameters.description: The inclusive sub-date to search from (YYYY-MM-DD)

parameters.name: periodTo
parameters.description: The inclusive sub-date to search to (YYYY-MM-DD)

parameters.name: originalPeriodFrom
parameters.description: The inclusive date to search from (YYYY-MM-DD)

parameters.name: originalPeriodTo
parameters.description: The inclusive date to search to (YYYY-MM-DD)

parameters.name: amountFrom
parameters.description: The amount to search from

parameters.name: amountTo
parameters.description: The amount to search to

parameters.name: searchText
parameters.description: A free-form text to filter by that searches through transaction description, merchant name, category name, currency, tags comments and transaction data

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The transaction description to filter by. If it's null, it will be ignored. But it is possible to search for empty descriptions.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: The transaction currency to filter by. If it's null or empty, it will be ignored.

parameters.name: comment
parameters.description: The transaction comment to filter by. If it's null, it will be ignored. But it is possible to search for empty comments.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: A comma separate string of tags to filter by

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: The order of the returned transactions.

parameters.name: parsedDataNameToOrderBy
parameters.description: The parsed data parameter to order by when OrderBy == {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionFilterOrderEnum.ByParsedData}.

parameters.name: ascendingOrder
parameters.description:
Whether or not to order the returned transactions in an ascending order. The order is specified by {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionFilterModel.OrderBy}
If nothing is specified, then the list will be ordered by date.

parameters.name: useAbsoluteAmountSearch
parameters.description:
Whether or not to use absolute amount search. 
If true, AmountFrom = 500 and AmountTo = 1000 searches from -1000 to -500 as well as +500 to + 1000

parameters.name: useAndSearchForTags
parameters.description:
Whether or not tags are searched with AND or OR.
If true, tags are searched with AND so the transactions returned will have to contain all the {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionFilterModel.Tags}.

parameters.name: useEqualsSearchForBankId
parameters.description: Whether or not BankId is searched with EQUALS or LIKE. If true, exact matches are found, otherwise matches that contain the search string for BankId.

parameters.name: useAmountInCurrencySearch
parameters.description:
DEPRECATED: Use {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionFilterModel.UseAmountFields} instead
Whether or not to search for amount in currency instead of amount

parameters.name: useExactDescription
parameters.description: If true, filters by exact (equals) description as opposed to contains (which is the default)

parameters.name: useExactMerchantTexts
parameters.description: If true, filters by exact (equals) merchant texts as opposed to contains (which is the default)

parameters.name: useAccentInsensitiveSearch
parameters.description: Whether the search performed is accent insensitive or not

parameters.name: merchantIds
parameters.description: A comma separate string of merchant Ids to filter by

parameters.name: excludeMerchantIds
parameters.description: A comma separate string of merchant Ids to exclude

parameters.name: merchantTexts
parameters.description: A comma separate string of merchant texts to filter by

parameters.name: parsedData
parameters.description:
The transaction data to filter by. The data is filtered with union semantics (OR)
example: [{"key":"reference","value":"ref123"},{"key":"reference","value":"ref124"}]
will find transactions with "ref123" OR "ref124" transaction data.

parameters.name: useAndSearchForParsedData
parameters.description: If true, then all the fields passed as {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionFilterModel.ParsedData} will be AND-ed together. If the same key appears more than once then they will be OR-ed together and AND-ed with the other keys. If false, they will be OR-ed together. Example: Given ParsedData: (Key=X,Value=x1),(Key=X,Value=x2),(Key=Y,Value=y1) When true: (X=x1 OR X=x2) AND Y=y1 When false: X=x1 OR X=x2 OR Y=y1

parameters.name: parsedDataExactKeys
parameters.description: List of keys in parsed data that should only return a match if the value is exactly the same as supplied in ParsedData

parameters.name: useParentMerchantIds
parameters.description:
If set to true, parent and the parents children will be found for each merchant id 
provided in {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionFilterModel.MerchantIds} and in {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionFilterModel.ExcludeMerchantIds} and they 
included in the filter. If the merchant has no parent then its children, if any, are added

parameters.name: excludeMerchantTexts
parameters.description: A comma separate string of merchant texts to exclude

parameters.name: bankIds
parameters.description: A comma separate string of bank Ids to filter by

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: A comma separate string of transaction Ids to filter by

parameters.name: useAmountFields
parameters.description:
This is a comma separated string of transactionAmountField values
that specifies which amount fields to use when searching using amountFrom
and amountTo. If useAmountInCurrencySearch = true then only
transactionAmountField.amountInCurrency is used. If useAmountInCurrencySearch = false
then this list is used. If the list is empty then transactionAmountField.amount is used.
Valid values are "amount" (0), "originalAmount" (1), "amountInCurrency" (2), and "bookedAmount" (3)

parameters.description:
The transaction data to filter by. The data is filtered with union semantics (OR)
example: [{"key":"reference","value":"ref123"},{"key":"reference","value":"ref124"}]
will find transactions with "ref123" OR "ref124" transaction data.

parameters.name: useAndSearchForParsedData
parameters.description: If true, then all the fields passed as {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionFilterModel.ParsedData} will be AND-ed together. If the same key appears more than once then they will be OR-ed together and AND-ed with the other keys. If false, they will be OR-ed together. Example: Given ParsedData: (Key=X,Value=x1),(Key=X,Value=x2),(Key=Y,Value=y1) When true: (X=x1 OR X=x2) AND Y=y1 When false: X=x1 OR X=x2 OR Y=y1

parameters.name: parsedDataExactKeys
parameters.description: List of keys in parsed data that should only return a match if the value is exactly the same as supplied in ParsedData

parameters.name: useParentMerchantIds
parameters.description:
If set to true, parent and the parents children will be found for each merchant id 
provided in {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionFilterModel.MerchantIds} and in {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionFilterModel.ExcludeMerchantIds} and they 
included in the filter. If the merchant has no parent then its children, if any, are added

parameters.name: excludeMerchantTexts
parameters.description: A comma separate string of merchant texts to exclude

parameters.name: bankIds
parameters.description: A comma separate string of bank Ids to filter by

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: A comma separate string of transaction Ids to filter by

parameters.name: useAmountFields
parameters.description:
This is a comma separated string of transactionAmountField values
that specifies which amount fields to use when searching using amountFrom
and amountTo. If useAmountInCurrencySearch = true then only
transactionAmountField.amountInCurrency is used. If useAmountInCurrencySearch = false
then this list is used. If the list is empty then transactionAmountField.amount is used.
Valid values are "amount" (0), "originalAmount" (1), "amountInCurrency" (2), and "bookedAmount" (3)

The Account Category as defined by the "GET /user/v1/accounts/accountcategories" endpoint.
Passed values can both be the integer id or the string name of the account category.

id.description: Unique Id and primary key for the Account in the database

accountIdentifier.description:
Identifier for the account set by the originating bank 
This identifier is used when getting Account statements

accountTypeId.description: The id of the account type

name.description: The Name of the account set by the user or the originating bank

balance.description: The current balance of the account

accountClass.description: The account class that is for example used for displaying an image for this account in CSS

organizationIdentifier.description: A code that identifies the organization associated with this account gloabally, such as Swift code

realmCredentialsId.description: Identifier for an online bank user that owns this account

accountAuthorizationType.description: Indicates the type of account authorization during account aggregation

orderId.description: Accounts are ordered in ascending order by this order key

isImportAccount.description: Indicates if this account assues transactions to be imported manually or not

lastUpdate.description: The last update time of this account

personId.description: Identifer for the person owning this account

userEmail.description: The email of the person owning this account

accountCategory.description: Indicates if this is a Current account, Credit account or Saving account

emergencyFundBalanceLimit.description:
If this account is used to track Life goals, this amount indicates the amount 
that is not used for goal allocation

inactive.description: True if the account is inactive

attachedToUserDate.description: DateTime when the user added this account

isHidden.description: True if the account should be hidden from widgets on the overview page

isDisabled.description: True if the this account should be exluded from all calculations

currencyCode.description: The currency code of the account

balanceInUserCurrency.description: Current balance of the account in the currency of the user

limitInUserCurrency.description: The limit or overdraft in the currency of the user

Meniga.Runtime.WebApi.Models.Common.Json.description: A document wrapper for API error responses

The base error response message class.

It formats the {System.Net.HttpStatusCode} passed in the  to a high level error {Meniga.Runtime.WebApi.Models.Common.JsonApiError.Message}
as defined by the HTTP spec: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616#section-10
E.g. for HTTP status code "400" the {Meniga.Runtime.WebApi.Models.Common.JsonApiError.Message} will be "Bad Request"
and for status code "500" {Meniga.Runtime.WebApi.Models.Common.JsonApiError.Message} will be "Internal Server Error"

message.description:
The title of the returned HTTP status code according the the HTTP spec,
e.g. for HTTP status code "400" the message will be "Bad Request"

messageDetails.description:
A detailed description of the error intended for the developer to understand exactly what failed.
This info is stripped from the response if error details are not configured to be emitted from the api.

Meniga.Runtime.WebApi.Models.Common.Json.description: A document wrapper for API responses

options.description: An option object for the request

sort.description:
Decides the order of the returned transactions, defined by a comma separated list of the properties of the Transaction object.
The sort order for each sort field is ascending unless it is prefixed with a "-" in which case it is descending.
If this string is null or empty then 'OrderBy' is used.
<para>
The supported Transaction fields are:
AccountId, Accuracy, Amount, AmountInCurrency, Balance,BankId, CategoryChangedTime, CategoryId, Date, DueDate, HasUserClearedCategoryUncertainty, Id,
IsFlagged,IsMerchant, IsOwnAccountTransfer, IsRead, IsSplitChild, IsUncleared, InsertTime, Mcc, MerchantId, ParentIdentifier, Text, Timestamp, CounterpartyAccountIdentifier,
Currency, HasUncertainCategorization, OriginalAmount, OriginalDate, OriginalText
</para>

accountIds.description: A comma separate string of account Ids to filter by

accountIdentifiers.description: A comma separate string of account identifiers to filter by

counterpartyAccountIdentifiers.description: A comma separate string of counterparty account identifiers (who person is paying) to filter by

categoryIds.description: A comma separate string of category Ids to filter by

categoryTypes.description: A comma separate string of category types to filter by. An enum of the category type are defined in the "GET /user/v1/categories/types" endpoint.

onlyUnread.description: Whether or not to only get unread transactions

onlyFlagged.description: Whether or not to only get flagged transactions

onlyUncertain.description: Whether or not to only get transactions with uncertain categorization

onlyUncategorized.description: Whether or not to only get uncategorized transactions

uncertainOrFlagged.description: Whether or not to get uncertain categorization or flagged transactions

hideExcluded.description: Whether or not to hide transactions in a excluded category

insertedBefore.description: If set, will only return transactions that have insert time before the supplied value

periodFrom.description: The inclusive sub-date to search from (YYYY-MM-DD)

periodTo.description: The inclusive sub-date to search to (YYYY-MM-DD)

originalPeriodFrom.description: The inclusive date to search from (YYYY-MM-DD)

originalPeriodTo.description: The inclusive date to search to (YYYY-MM-DD)

searchText.description: A free-form text to filter by that searches through transaction description, merchant name, category name, currency, tags comments and transaction data

description.description: The transaction description to filter by. If it's null, it will be ignored. But it is possible to search for empty descriptions.

currency.description: The transaction currency to filter by. If it's null or empty, it will be ignored.

comment.description: The transaction comment to filter by. If it's null, it will be ignored. But it is possible to search for empty comments.

tags.description: A comma separate string of tags to filter by

orderBy.description: The order of the returned transactions.

parsedDataNameToOrderBy.description: The parsed data parameter to order by when OrderBy == {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionFilterOrderEnum.ByParsedData}.

ascendingOrder.description:
Whether or not to order the returned transactions in an ascending order. The order is specified by {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionFilterModel.OrderBy}
If nothing is specified, then the list will be ordered by date.

useAbsoluteAmountSearch.description:
Whether or not to use absolute amount search. 
If true, AmountFrom = 500 and AmountTo = 1000 searches from -1000 to -500 as well as +500 to + 1000

useAndSearchForTags.description:
Whether or not tags are searched with AND or OR.
If true, tags are searched with AND so the transactions returned will have to contain all the {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionFilterModel.Tags}.

useEqualsSearchForBankId.description: Whether or not BankId is searched with EQUALS or LIKE. If true, exact matches are found, otherwise matches that contain the search string for BankId.

useAmountInCurrencySearch.description:
DEPRECATED: Use {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionFilterModel.UseAmountFields} instead
Whether or not to search for amount in currency instead of amount

useExactDescription.description: If true, filters by exact (equals) description as opposed to contains (which is the default)

useExactMerchantTexts.description: If true, filters by exact (equals) merchant texts as opposed to contains (which is the default)

useAccentInsensitiveSearch.description: Whether the search performed is accent insensitive or not

merchantIds.description: A comma separate string of merchant Ids to filter by

excludeMerchantIds.description: A comma separate string of merchant Ids to exclude

merchantTexts.description: A comma separate string of merchant texts to filter by

parsedData.description:
The transaction data to filter by. The data is filtered with union semantics (OR)
example: [{"key":"reference","value":"ref123"},{"key":"reference","value":"ref124"}]
will find transactions with "ref123" OR "ref124" transaction data.

useAndSearchForParsedData.description: If true, then all the fields passed as {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionFilterModel.ParsedData} will be AND-ed together. If the same key appears more than once then they will be OR-ed together and AND-ed with the other keys. If false, they will be OR-ed together. Example: Given ParsedData: (Key=X,Value=x1),(Key=X,Value=x2),(Key=Y,Value=y1) When true: (X=x1 OR X=x2) AND Y=y1 When false: X=x1 OR X=x2 OR Y=y1

parsedDataExactKeys.description: List of keys in parsed data that should only return a match if the value is exactly the same as supplied in ParsedData

useParentMerchantIds.description:
If set to true, parent and the parents children will be found for each merchant id

isRead.description: Whether or not the transaction has been read

accountId.description: The id of the account of the transaction

lastModifiedTime.description: Time when this transaction was last modified

userData.description: Holds extra custom data that is not parsed or read via the transaction data format parser

bookedAmount.description: The original amount of this transaction in account currency

splitRatio.description: The split ratio of the transaction (Amount/OriginalAmount)

transactionFilter.description:
A Filter used to filter out the set of transactions which the series are generated from.
Note: Each {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionSeries} has its own filter which allows for selecting a subset of the transactions queried using this filter.
Note : The PeriodFrom and PeriodTo properties always need to be populated.

options.description: Option object for the Transaction Series List.

seriesSelectors.description: A list of SeriesRequests each containing its own filter in order to select a subset of the "main" set.

Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionFilter.description: A data object used to filter transactions

accountIds.description: The account IDs to filter by

accountIdentifiers.description: The account identifiers to filter by, {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.AccountModel.AccountIdentifier}

counterpartyAccountIdentifiers.description: The counterparty account identifers to filter by

categoryIds.description: The category IDs to filter by

categoryTypes.description: The category types to filter by

onlyUnread.description: Whether or not to only get unread transactions

onlyFlagged.description: Whether or not to only get flagged transactions

onlyUncertain.description: Whether or not to only get transactions with uncertain categorization

onlyUncategorized.description: Whether or not to only get uncategorized transactions

uncertainOrFlagged.description: Whether or not to get uncertain categorization or flagged transactions

hideExcluded.description: Whether or not to hide excluded transactions

insertedBefore.description: If set, will only return transactions that have insert time before the supplied value

originalPeriodFrom.description: The inclusive date to search from (the value provided has to be contained within the date interval defined by {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionFilter.PeriodFrom} and {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionFilter.PeriodTo})

originalPeriodTo.description: The inclusive date to search to (the value provided has to be contained within the date interval defined by {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionFilter.PeriodFrom} and {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionFilter.PeriodTo})

searchText.description: A free-form text to filter by that searches through transaction description, merchant name, category name, currency, tags comments and transaction data

description.description: The transaction description to filter by. If it's null, it will be ignored. But it is possible to search for empty descriptions.

bankId.description: The Bank Id to filter by. If it's null, it will be ignored.

currency.description: The transaction currency to filter by. If it's null or empty, it will be ignored.

comment.description: The transaction comment to filter by. If it's null, it will be ignored. But it is possible to search for empty comments.

orderBy.description: The order of the returned transactions.

parsedDataNameToOrderBy.description: The parsed data parameter to order by when OrderBy == {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionFilterOrderEnum.ByParsedData}.

ascendingOrder.description: Whether or not to order the returned transactions in an ascending order

useAbsoluteAmountSearch.description:
Whether or not to use absolute amount search. 
If true, AmountFrom = 500 and AmountTo = 1000 searches from -1000 to -500 as well as +500 to + 1000

useAndSearchForTags.description:
Whether or not tags are searched with AND or OR.
If true, tags are searched with AND so the transactions returned will have to contain all the {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionFilter.Tags}.

useEqualsSearchForBankId.description: Whether or not BankId is searched with EQUALS or LIKE. If true, exact matches are found, otherwise matches that contain the search string for BankId.

useAmountInCurrencySearch.description:
DEPRECATED: Use {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionFilter.UseAmountFields} instead
Whether or not to search for amount in currency instead of amount.

useExactDescription.description: If true, filters by exact (equals) description as opposed to contains (which is the default).

useExactMerchantTexts.description: If true, filters by exact (equals) merchant texts as opposed to contains (which is the default).

useAccentInsensitiveSearch.description: Whether the search performed is accent insensitive or not.

merchantIds.description: The merchant IDs to filter by

merchantTexts.description: The merchant texts to filter by

parsedData.description:
The transaction data to filter by. The data is filtered with union semantics (OR)
example: [{"key":"reference","value":"ref123"},{"key":"reference","value":"ref124"}]
will find transactions with "ref123" OR "ref124" transaction data.

useAndSearchForParsedData.description: If true, then all the fields passed as {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionFilter.ParsedData} will be AND-ed together. If the same key appears more than once then they will be OR-ed together and AND-ed with the other keys. If false, they will be OR-ed together. Example: Given ParsedData: (Key=X,Value=x1),(Key=X,Value=x2),(Key=Y,Value=y1) When true: (X=x1 OR X=x2) AND Y=y1 When false: X=x1 OR X=x2 OR Y=y1

parsedDataExactKeys.description: List of keys in parsed data that should only return a match if the value is exactly the same as supplied in ParsedData

useParentMerchantIds.description:
If set to true, parent and the parents children will be found for each merchant id 
provided in {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionFilter.MerchantIds} and in {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionFilter.ExcludeMerchantIds} and they 
included in the filter. If the merchant has no parent then its children, if any, are added

bankIds.description: List of Bankid's to filter by, if this is set it will be used instead of {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionFilter.BankId}. If it's null, it will be ignored.

ids.description: List of transaction id's to filter by

externalMerchantIdentifiers.description: List of external merchant identifiers on transactions

merchantCategoryCodes.description: List of merchant category codes ( MCC ).

descriptions.description:
The transaction descriptions to filter by. If it's null or empty, it will be ignored. Searching for empty descriptions is possible.
If this property is set and is not empty, then the {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionFilter.Description} property will be ignored regardless of its value.

useOriginalDescription.description: If true, filters by the original description (transaction text from bank).

useAmountFields.description:
Tells which {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionModel} amount fields to use when searching using {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionFilter.AmountFrom}
and {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionFilter.AmountTo}. However, if {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionFilter.UseAmountInCurrencySearch} = true then only
{Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionAmountField.AmountInCurrency} is used. If {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionFilter.UseAmountInCurrencySearch} = false
then this list is used but if the list is empty then {Meniga.Core.Api.Models.TransactionAmountField.Amount} is used.

sort.description:
Decides the order of the returned transactions, defined by a comma separated list of the properties of the Transaction object.
The sort order for each sort field is ascending unless it is prefixed with a "-" in which case it is descending.
If this string is null or empty then 'OrderBy' is used.
<para>
The supported Transaction fields are:
AccountId, Accuracy, Amount, AmountInCurrency, Balance,BankId, CategoryChangedTime, CategoryId, Date, DueDate, HasUserClearedCategoryUncertainty, Id,
IsFlagged,IsMerchant, IsOwnAccountTransfer, IsRead, IsSplitChild, IsUncleared, InsertTime, Mcc, MerchantId, ParentIdentifier, Text, Timestamp, CounterpartyAccountIdentifier,
Currency, HasUncertainCategorization, OriginalAmount, OriginalDate, OriginalText
</para>

dayOfMonth.description:
The day-of-month field of the cron expression. If null, the wildcard character * is assumed
Allowed values: null, 1-31

dayOfMonthInterval.description:
The interval field for the day-of-month in the cron expression. Used in conjunction with DayOfMonth.
If null, the specified DayOfMonth is assumed.
Allowed values: null, 0-N

month.description:
The month field of the cron expression. If null, the wildcard character * is assumed
Allowed values: null, 1-12

monthInterval.description:
The interval field for the month in the cron expression. Used in conjunction with Month.
If null, the specified month is assumed
Allowed values: null, 0-N

dayOfWeek.description:
The day-of-week field of the cron expression. If null, the wildcard character * is assumed.
Allowed values: null, 0-6 where 0 = Sunday

dayOfWeekInterval.description:
The interval field for the day-of-week in the cron expression. Used in conjunction with DayOfWeek.
If null, the specified DayOfWeek is assumed
Allowed values: null, 0-N

weekOfYear.description:
The week-of-year field of the cron expression.
The server will calculate the correct week of year from this field, according to ISO8601 specification.
If null, the wildcard character * is assumed
Allowed values: null or any valid date value

weekInterval.description:
The interval field for the week-of-year in the cron expression. Used in conjunction with WeekOfYear.
If null, the specified WeekOfYear is assumed
Allowed values: null, 0-N
